cboCostEstimates.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on Oversight and Reform on May 11, 2022
cboCostEstimates.title: H.R. 7417, Legislation to Name United States Post Offices

constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 61 (Wednesday, April 6, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mrs. BICE of Oklahoma:
H.R. 7417.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article 1, Section 8, Clause 7. To establish Post Offices
and post Roads.
[Page H4397]

latestAction.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 120 East Oak Avenue in Seminole, Oklahoma, as the "Sergeant Bret D. Isenhower Memorial Post Office Building".
